name: Sultans Royal Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic holiday at the Sultans Royal Hotel in October 2012. This beautiful small boutique hotel is at the heart of Sultan Ahmet and it is very close to the main attractions such as Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and Hagia Sophia (just 5 minutes of walking range).
reviews.title: Beautiful Small Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean, the rooms are nicely furnished and well appointed, and the breakfast is fabulous (open buffet and lots of choices).
reviews.title: The place to stay in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is splendid, all of them were so friendly and warm-hearted. In particular, Erhan was so helpful about how to spend our time wisely and efficiently during our stay (giving the required information regarding restaurants, main attractions and etc…)
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: As guests who found this hotel accidentally after an extremely bad experience at another hotel in İstanbul, we have to admit that we did enjoy every minute of our stay. Everything about this hotel was first class, from the moment we arrived to the moment we left.
reviews.title: Great location, super friendly staff.
It's all about location and friendly service
reviews.text: To sum up, I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone for a perfect stay. The reviews are totally true and if we ever return to Istanbul, we wouldn’t consider staying anywhere else.

I recently stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in November. Boy, did I love this hotel. All the wonderful comments on TripAdivsor are true. Sultans Royal is a nice boutique hotel with 16 rooms. The front desk staff makes it a point to address you by name each day.
reviews.title: Istanbul's best hotel
5 Star Turkish hospitality!
reviews.text: I was traveling solo to Istanbul and because I was staying 6 nights, I received free pickup and return to the airport by booking through their website. It was so nice to arrive after a very long trip and see a young man holding up my name.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome I received at the hotel was outstanding. The room I had was a good size, exceptionally clean and spotless and with a good size bathroom. Lots of towels, plenty of water pressure in the shower and good toiletries.
reviews.title: As Good as Reviewers Say

reviews.text: The room had plenty of closet space to store my clothes. Each room has a mini bar (small fridge) with the least expensive items I have ever seen. A bottle of cold water is .5 Turkish lira which is about 25 cents US dollar. Why lug around bottles of water, when you can purchase them so cheaply?
reviews.title: Wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was heaven. Lots of grilled vegetables - I am still dreaming about the roasted eggplant and red peppers - fresh fruit, pastries, cheeses, jams, etc. The breakfast room was nice and cosy.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed here with my father towards the end of October, 2012. We booked directly through their website and received a complimentary airport pick up. I booked the hotel less than 24 hours prior to arrival, and they were there waiting for us when we arrived. This foreshadowed just how much care was taken for us our entire stay. The staff at the hotel are like none other I have come across. In most hotels, people are cordial and helpful... but here, they consider it THEIR responsibility to point you to the best places, deals, and experiences. Each person working the desk has their own personal taste and recommendations, all which were quite impressive. The location of the hotel is a 5-7 minute walk to Blue Mosque, where all the action begins. LEARN TO TAKE THE TRAM SYSTEM, AVOID TAXI CABS IF AT ALL POSSIBLE. If you are from out of town, it is very difficult to follow the city on a map while being driven around and it is easy to be taken advantage of. If you take a taxi to the hotel and are suspicious about the rate, ask the front desk to come check on it. Remember: The fare should be cheap. This is not New York City.
reviews.title: Great Value, Staff and Location. Highly Safe.

reviews.text: A previous reviewer commented on the breakfast being less than par. I disagree. Just because you don't like the tastes on the buffet doesn't mean it needs to be improved. It was classic Mediterranean/Turkish style. Personally, when I travel to places I like to try their regional cuisine.
reviews.title: Excellent location, friendly & helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wireless internet was strong and free. Very important.
reviews.title: Lovely, friendly hotel near Blue Mosque

reviews.text: Thank you to the staff, who I am now friends with on Facebook. I will return someday and see them again.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel - breakfast needs to be improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location within easy walk from major attractions. Quiet and picturesque street. Staff is very friendly and helpful upon any question or request. Room a bit small but comfortable, clean and well equipped. Safe in room too small for laptop.
reviews.title: A Really Charming Experience

reviews.text: The staff at this boutique hotel are warm, friendly and unfailingly helpful. The room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean and light with opening windows which makes all the difference for me. And you can walk easily to the major ancient Istanbul sites in Sultanahmet and to transport which gets you everywhere. I hope to return.
reviews.title: perfect place to explore Istanbul

reviews.text: I recently spent a wonderful 4 days in this hotel. It is well located with comfortable rooms and the best staff that I have encountered in all my travels to 138 countries.
reviews.title: A very special place!!

reviews.text: Everyone was welcoming and helpful. My travel companion was not feeling well and they went out of their way to see to her needs. I will definitely stay at the Sultan's Royal again.
reviews.title: Excellent service and location

reviews.text: I stayed in the family suite this summer with my two younger sisters and boyfriend. Turkey was the most foreign place any of us had been, but the English speaking hotel staff made it very easy on us. They arranged a car for us to and from the airport as repeatedly gave us directions and local recommendations. Our rooms were very clean, and the location was perfect walking distance to restaurants, shopping, sights, and the tram. I would absolutely stay here again!
reviews.title: Sultans Royal Hotel

reviews.text: Your hotel is excellent. I enjoyed my stay. The rooms are comfortable and the breakfast very good. The staff of the hotel is very polite. The service was perfect. Thank you! I will recommend your hotel to my friends.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location, Warm & Helpful Staff, Great Value

description: Sultans Royal Hotel Istanbul is not just another new hotel on Istanbul’s historic peninsular. Situated 5 minutes walking distance to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace Musem, Underground Cistern and other historical, cultural monuments in Sultanahmet. Sultans Royal small but classic, elegant, recently restored 3 story hotel is ideally located for exploring and discovering this enchanting city and the perfect place to relax while planning your next day’s expedition into Istanbul’s colourful and exciting history.
